inn1.comm: some movement straight away, gets a good length ball to move away a tad outside off, left alone by Guptill
short of a length, tries to tuck to the leg side and gets pinged on the pad. Heading down leg and height a factor too
gets on to the front foot and defends to the on side
good length ball outside off, Latham shoulders arms
length ball on middle and off, Latham tucks to the leg side and the ball is fielded in the midwicket region

some movement inwards to the right-hander. It's short of a length and nipping back in from around the middle stump channel. Guptill tries to glance but wears it on the pad instead and the ball goes away to the fine leg boundary
short of good length ball outside off, Latham defends with an open bat face to backward point
some late movement away from the left-hander. Good length ball on middle and off and shaping away, Latham gets it away to deep backward point for a single
nice fuller ball that angles away from the right-hander. Close enough for Guptill to play at it but he does well to leave it alone
fuller ball on middle and leg, Guptill presses forward and knocks it to mid-on
fuller ball, angled away from the right-hander again, but this one is a lot wider and it's an easy leave for Guptill

fuller ball, holding its line outside off, Guptill defends it towards mid-off and takes off for a quick single as he gets it to the left of the bowler. Not a bad start that from Mustafizur. Hit decent lines and lengths
short of a length, on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
Mashrafe attacks the stumps but that's not the ideal length. It's short of a length and Guptill responds with a muscular heave over deep midwicket. Got just about enough room to free his arms
good length ball, Guptill knocks it down the ground towards mid-on and the bowler dives to his right on the follow-through to cut it off but they have enough time to comfortably complete the single
length ball outside off, Latham's bat turns as he defends it from the crease and nearly comes off his hand
fuller ball, pushed across the left-hander outside off, Latham is happy to let it go to the wicketkeeper
short and wide outside off, Latham is quick to open his arms and cracks a punch off the backfoot through point
full and wide outside off, Guptill goes at it with hard hands and punches hard but straight to the fielder at short cover
fuller ball, width on offer outside off, Guptill frees his arms and lofts it clean over mid-off
good length ball, pitches on leg and moves away slightly late, Guptill gets behind it and blocks solidly from the crease
good length ball that pitches on middle and leg at 112kph, and Gupill blocks into the off side
short of good length, angling away outside off, Guptill shuffles across, rides the bounce and blocks into the off side
back of a length ball, tucked off the hips behind square. Another testing over from Mustafizur. He has already begun showing his variations
back of a length ball, angling in, tucked with the angle off the pads, fine leg makes a diving save
short of good length outside off, punched off the backfoot into the off side
good length ball outside off, opens the face of his bat and runs it down to third man
back of a length, tucked off the pads behind square

comes back in sharply from the short of a length region and beats everyone. Latham was shuffling across and looking to tuck it away but the ball misses the inside edge, narrowly misses the stumps and beats the wicketkeeper too who flings himself to the right
tries to glance and gets hit on the pads. Mustafizur appeals but the ball was heading down leg

first wicket for Mustafizur. It's the slower delivery and Guptill does not pick it up. It was full and on leg and middle channel. Guptill was looking to loft him straight down the ground but his bat face opens awkwardly as he makes contact and he ends up skying it towards mid-off where Soumya Sarkar takes it easily
fuller ball, angling down leg. Latham misses the flick to the leg side and gets rapped on the pads. Mustafizur goes up excitedly but that was clearly missing leg
fired down the leg side. Latham misses the tuck to the leg side and misses
short of a length ball outside off. Latham gets on top of the bounce and turns it away into the leg side
fuller ball, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg
short of a length ball, angled across and holding its line just outside off. Williamson punches off the backfoot through the covers region
sprays it down the leg side and Latham misses the glance
short of a length ball outside off, punched off the backfoot and point dives to his right to make the save
short of a length ball outside off and Williamson punches it superbly off the backfoot square of the wicket but backward point flings himself to his left to field it
angling down the leg side. The ball goes to the wicketkeeper as Williamson looks to glance it fine. Bangladesh go up in appeal but it's not given. That came off the pad
good length ball on the stumps, Williamson blocks with soft hands and gets it off the outside edge before third man cuts it off
good length ball on the fourth-stump channel, defended solidly back towards the bowler
fuller ball a set of stumps outside off and swinging further away, Williamson strides across and lets it go to the wicketkeeper
back of a length, angling in around off, defended solidly off the backfoot to the off side
short of good length, angling in to the left-hander, Latham turns it away off the hips to deep backward square leg
short of good length ball, angled across outside off. Williamson shuffles across a long way and chops his defence into the ground in the off side
back of a length, pushed across around the fifth-stump channel outside off, Williamson shuffles across and drops it into the off side off the backfoot
short ball, Williamson swivels around and pulls but straight to deep square leg
good length ball, nipping in from the fourth-stump channel, Latham stays in the crease and turns it into the on side
sees some width on offer outside off and brings out a lovely slap off the backfoot but picks out point
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side off the backfoot
fuller ball on the fourth or fifth stump channel, Williamson gets nicely forward and puts his head down as he defends it back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, Williamson jumps up to ride the bounce and punches it square of the wicket
short of good length ball, angling in slightly from outside off, Williamson defends off the backfoot to the covers region
length ball on the stumps, nipping back in slightly, Williamson defends with a straight bat down the pitch
width on offer outside off, Williamson slaps it square of the wicket to deep backward point
starts off with a nothing delivery, short and gives enough width outside off for Williamson to free his arms and crack it through point
width on offer again, Williamson slaps but chops it towards point
fuller ball, angling in on the stumps, Williamson pushes it with a closed face of the bat to midwicket
pacy delivery, 140kph, but offers generous width again. Williamson slaps but there is a man in the deep in the backward point region and he it goes straight to him
short ball, Latham controls the pull shot towards deep backward square leg to bring up New Zealand's fifty
ends a wayward first over with a short of good length ball outside off that is punched off the backfoot to point
loopy length ball on middle and leg, clipped through square leg for a single
short and wide, cut off the backfoot to sweeper cover
comes neatly forward to this fuller ball and defends it back to the bowler
fuller ball, fetches a sweep from outside off and sends it to deep backward square leg who slightly over-runs the ball and fails to collect it cleanly. They take the second off the misfield

short of a length ball, not much turn, tucked off the pads through the vacant square leg region. They take two by the time the fielders at deep midwicket and deep backward square leg can converge on the ball
punches this back of a length ball off the backfoot square of the wicket
short of a length ball at 118kph, tucked easily off the pads to deep midwicket
very full and swinging away wide outside off, Williamson tries to cut it and gets a bottom-edges it to the wicketkeeper
fuller ball, moves away a tad outside off, left alone
tries to cut but Sarkar gets some good bounce from the short of good length region and Williamson is slightly caught off guard as he is beaten
short ball, Williamson executs a neat pull shot, hits it hard and comfortably beats the fielder running across from deep backward square leg as the ball crosses the deep midwicket boundary
width on offer outside off, Williamson cuts and beats the sweeper cover fielder who runs across. Goes past  4000 ODI runs. Joint fourth-fastest to the landmark in terms of innings
good length ball, tucked off the pads to deep backward square leg
yorker on middle, Williamson jams his bat down and digs it out to mid-on
short of good length ball on the stumps, Williamson flat-bats it down the ground, just wide of mid-on and takes a quick single
length ball, clipped off the pads to midwicket
fuller ball, a set of stumps outside off, holding its line, left alone
short ball, lays into a pull shot as the ball races away past the deep square leg region. Deep backward square leg does not bother running across. Hit very hard
tries to tuck to the leg side after it pitches outside leg and gets it off the pad as the ball rolls away down the pitch
opens the face of his bat to runs this one down to third man
takes off for a quick run after pushing this fuller ball to mid-off. Shakib fires a direct hit at the non-striker's end. They go upstairs to check but Latham's timely dive means he is well inside
back of a length and angling in, tucked through midwicket off the pads. Calls for two straight away and completes it comfortably as two fielders converge in the deep
fuller ball outside off, driven off the front foot to covers
fuller outside off, defended with an open bat face to backward point
the accumulation continues as Latham waits on a back of a length delivery on off stump and jabs it in front of point

nicks off! Taskin's extra bounce has turned Williamson's strength into a weakness. His eyes lit up at the short ball, the width tempted him as well. But the big, scary fast bowler has done him in by making the ball kick up a little more. Effort ball. Massive wicket
good length ball on off stump, defended
looks for the yorker and executes it well enough, Broom is almost falling over as he digs it out
stands tall behind a short of a length delivery outside off and punches with a straight bat to cover
hoists his bat skyward as he allows a back of a length delivery to waltz across to the wicketkeeper
deep in his crease, opens the face and exploits the angle across him - can do that on a true-paced pitch - to find a single at deep point
covers the line of a delivery on off stump and drills it into the covers off the back foot. Off the mark, is Broom. That'll help him calm down
fuller delivery on off stump, brings Latham forward to block. "Wait," he screams as point comes into the picture
tips a length ball on off stump to square leg by planting his front leg across.
defends a good length ball aimed at the top of off stump
steps forward and knocks a fuller delivery on middle to mid-on
steers a fuller ball outside off past point's right
flicks to midwicket as Taskin keeps a tight line and length on off stump
back of a length on off stump, with no room to work with, the new batsman, a returning batsman is kept waiting to feel set
glides to third man to escape the pressure being built
fuller delivery on off stump gets a nicely-timed drive to mid-off in response

plays late as he slices a full and wide delivery to the deep third man, where the fielder mucks up. Lazy pick up with one hand, doesn't get the ball in his grasp and gives away the extra run. Mustafizur the culprit
shortish and outside off, slapped to deep point
full on off stump, worked to mid-on
smacks a full toss through point, it's heading to the boundary until the man in the deep puts in an excellent dive to intercept it.
whoa! That's a poor length to bowl considering his pace, but Latham latched onto it so well. Deposits the short ball over the midwicket boundary. Signs that he is picking the length early
stands up tall behind a shortish delivery on fourth stump and bops it to mid-off
slower delivery - pushed full on middle - Latham is trying to work across the line into the leg side, but checks his shot just in time
rocks back having sized up a short ball outside off and cuts to deep third man
meets a bouncer rising up towards his throat and pulls it down to fine leg. Good balance, shifting his weight back and getting his hands high to prevent top-edges.
on the pads and Broom flicks it to long leg to bring up the hundred. Decent foundation, who do New Zealand have in the shed to light the fire?

splits the two men in the deep with the pull! Taskin seems to want to intimidate batsmen who have been brought up on these pacy and bouncy pitches. He's getting a little bit carried away to be honest, and this shot, so supremely controlled by Latham is proof. Swivels on his back foot, rolls his wrist on top of the ball.
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to mid-off. Slight misfield there allows the run
nudges across to work a length ball on off stump to long leg
considering the flatter trajectory, he stays back and punches a drive to long-on
ooh, the shortish delivery seems to sit in the pitch and Broom, trying to play with the turn to midwicket, is into the shot too early. Leading edge down the pitch
reads the pace of the ball a bit better as he takes it from off stump and sends it through midwicket
allows the batsman to camp back, Latham plays with the turn through the gap at cover
a hint more flight on off stump, and that sets Broom up for the sweep. Powerful hit to square leg
drills a short and wide delivery through the covers, with a straight bat
drifts it down leg to start, and since this is Christchurch and not Chittagong, there is no turn. Broom tries a flick and misses
uses the angle into him again and flicks a quicker delivery on the pads to long leg. Just enough of an inside edge to go past fine leg's right
lovely deception. The trajectory is flat, but the length is full. Latham spotted the first thing and went back. Manages to adjust with a straight bat push to long-on
gets down the track and nudges it to long-on
steps forward to a length ball, blocks it to cover, and runs before the fielder realises what's happening
the wicketkeeper bellows a huge appeal for leg before as Latham sweeps a good length ball

a thick outside edge to third man, as he goes back to a length ball and tries to hit through cover. Looked pretty close that. Umpire may have been wondering about if the impact was outside off. Bangladesh have a review, but they do not use it
stays back to a rather full delivery - that's because Mosaddek bowls it flat - and pushes into the covers
flicks to square leg, going deep in the crease
almost falls over as he tries to go as far back as he could to pull a length ball from outside off to deep square leg
jumps down the track and lumps a length ball to deep midwicket. Good old slog across the line. Always has a place in cricket
works it away to square leg again
comes down the track, but is only allowed to find mid-on

lovely bowling. He slowed it down, and tossed it up a little more. Latham comes down the track, but is unsure as he sees the ball dip on him. Checks his shot - a flick - and gets a leading edge to cover
big old sweep to long leg, as he takes a flighted delivery on middle and rolls his wrists on it

goes for the chip over extra cover, and he seems to have timed it a lot better than he would have liked. Carries all the way to the man in the deep, Mahmudullah, who comes running to his left, sizes it up, has it in his hands and then it pops up. Dropped. Shakib's not amused
slighted onto middle and off, comes in with the angle, defended
short on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, punched to deep point
jumps back in his crease as he sees a short ball, likes the look of it so much that he goes to fifty with it, cutting behind point. Fine show on Boxing Day on his home ground
flighted on off stump, Broom sweeps, as John pointed out, to long leg
not quite short enough to pull - a bit too quick as well at 96 kph - and the ball, which is outside off, goes through to the keeper
steps back, and a touch away from the flatter delivery outside off, and nails it through cover
pastes a short delivery outside off stump to deep midwicket. Loads of bottom-handed power
lovely little whip of the wrists as he takes a fuller delivery on off stump and plants it in the real estate at long-on
full, but fast, on off stump, Latham leans over it as he pushes to long-on
moves back and punches to mid-on

caught in front as he plays all around a skidder! It isn't exactly as short as he thought and the second he went back to it, he was in trouble. Broom had got into a routine flicking the left-arm spinner since there isn't any turn on this pitch. But Shakib has one-upped him by a subtle change in length and his quicker pace. Batsman hits across the line, misses, bowler bowling wicket-to-wicket strikes. Simple
pulls out the sweep, and nails it. Shakib lobs one up from around the wicket, Neesham relies on his reach to get to the pitch of the ball and then his power takes care of the rest
flighted outside off, pushed to long-on
stays back to a fuller delivery, but unlike Broom, he plays with a straight bat. Better a dot than a wicket
flighted delivery outside off, driven to the bowler's right, Mosaddek does well, putting in a full-length dive
good length on off stump, opens the face into the covers
patted down to long-on off the back foot
puts in a little more flight into this delivery, and it seems to drift away from the left-hander, who was running down the track. Latham drives through extra cover
huge appeal for lbw, but there seemed to be two noises. Nevertheless, Bangladesh want a second look though. And HotSpot confirms an inside edge. Review shot down
nudges to square leg off the front foot
takes a flighted delivery from outside off and gently works it to midwicket
strides down the pitch, but he isn't able to beat midwicket again
resorts to the sweep, and this fuller, flatter delivery coming in with the angle seems as good a ball as any do do so

plays inside the line, expecting turn and is beaten all ends up! Gorgeous bowling. He pitches it on a good length, making sure the batsman can't reach it on the full. Neesham is worried about the turn. He is nervous. He plays only half a shot and is comfortably trumped
fires it in on a full length outside off, but the flatter trajectory makes him go back. Pushes to mid-on
a little slower though the air this time, on a good length outside off, Latham goes back and flicks to deep midwicket

drags a flighted delivery outside off to the fine leg boundary. Lovely placement. And judgment of when to play the sweep too. This one gave him the room to free the arms, and allows him the liberty of playing the shot without worrying about lbw
flighted outside off, driven through the covers
pushed through on middle and leg, Neesham is back to punch to long-on
worked away towards midwicket, a little uppishly, but it was nowhere close to the fielder

looped up, but it is very wide outside off, Latham stays back and chops it through point. Off-balanced through though, for the fielder was running rapidly to his right and threw without gaining a proper base.
quicker and down the leg side, flicked through to deep square leg
picked away to long-on, as he leans over a full and fast delivery on off stump
mid-off was up, and this was tossed up wide of off stump. Neesham is waiting for this. Leaps down the track and hoists him over his head
nudges to short midwicket as Shakib tosses it up, slower

pinned in front again! Second batsman to stay back to a ball that is too full. That's the reason the umpire was confident putting his finger up even if the ball was tailing into leg. It doesn't have too much distance to travel thereafter. Neesham walks off, having committed two mistakes. Misreading the length, and flicking across the line
flights it on off stump, defends uncertainly
steps forward to block a tossed up ball
dabbed to long-on
tossed up on off stump, tucked away thorugh midwicket
moves back to a flatter delivery outside off and taps it wide of long-on
good length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers

slogs it over long-on. It's a length ball. It allows him to get under it. There's no turn here to worry about hitting against it. He takes a chance and it pays off. New Zealand know they need a big total on this batting beauty
pushed through on leg stump, drifting into him, Munro drills it back at the bowler
down the leg side, and Munro nudges it to deep square leg. Fumble down there from Sabbir, under pressure by the batsmen's quick running between the wicket
width on offer, worse it's overpitched. Munro laces it through the covers. Everything right about that shot. everything wrong about that ball
good length ball on off stump, Munro is rooted to the crease and defends it off the pitch
moves back and away to the leg side to push a flatter delivery on leg stump to cover
full, on leg stump, Munro clips to midwicket

almost a catch to cover! Lovely deception with the flight. He makes Munro think this is a half-volley too. And with the line being well wide of off stump, the batsman goes for another cover drive. Only to realise the ball dips and he ends up hitting in the air, luckily to the right of the fielder
shimmies down the track and flicks a flighted delivery on middle to long-on's left

flighted, it's a little slower through the air as well, Latham is forward with a block. Seems to think there is a single when the ball doesn't even carry off the cut stripe. Mushfiqur does well, diving forward and pulling off a back flick. Misses the stumps though
gets down the track and drives to long-on
back of a length on off stump, pushed to long-on again
short of a length, punches to cover
gets inside the line of a tossed up delivery outside off and tries to hit the cover drive way too hard, and perhaps a touch too early as well. Inside edge to short fine leg
back of a length ball, coming in to the left-hander. Latham cuts and point makes a diving save
short and wide ball, Latham slaps and still can't beat point
pitched up now. Latham strides forward and closes the bat face as he pushes it to short extra cover
fuller ball, holding its line outside off, driven to sweeper cover
pitched up on the fourth-stump line, no feet from Munro as he drives it out to sweeper cover
fuller ball, clipped off the pads to mid-on
starts off with a slower ball, Munro waits in the crease before leaning back and opening the face of his bat to point
sprays it full and on the pads, clipped away through midwicket

tries to tuck this back of a length ball to the leg side. It's the off-cutter again and Latham can't get any sort of timing on it as he inside-edges it to the pads and the ball goes away to the off side
fuller ball at 125.8 click, pushed back to the bowler
short and wide, no pace absolutely again, Munro chops the cut to backward point

tries to punch off the backfoot but because there is no pace he is into the shot too early and gets it uppishly past the bowler. An inch closer and he could have easily been caught and bowled. Mighty close. Actually, Mustafizur instinctively ducked
punched off the backfoot into the off side
good length outside off, Latham comes forward and drops it in front of point before taking off for a quick single
good length on the stumps, blocked from the crease
fuller ball, pushed past the right of the bowler who sticks his leg out but can't get it to ball
fuller ball, comes forward and drives to mid-off
fuller ball, comes forward and drives to extra cover who dives to make the stop
short ball, Latham pulls and straight to deep midwicket
short and wide, cut away to deep backward point, gets it wide of the fielder inside the circle who can't stop it despite diving and they come back for a quick second
slower short ball, Munro is through with the pull shot way too early and gets beaten
short ball, cut to sweeper cover
fuller ball, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg
short and wide, cut to the left of point. Back-to-back boundaries to end the over

hammered through the covers. There's nothing pretty about that. If you're a budding fast bowler, watching this flat-batted wallop, you would curl under your covers and cry. Back of a length ball, abused
shortish and just outside off, Munro taps and runs to point
fuller delivery outside off, driven through cover
angles it into the left-hander from around the wicket, Munro clips it through vacant midwicket

run-out chance as Munro hurtles out of his crease, responding to his partner taking a few steps down after defending to the right of the bowler. Top work from Mashrafe, running across to the ball, picking it up and quickly turning around to aim for the correct end.
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
length ball, turns it away to the on side
shot. Full and asking to be hit. Gets the front leg outside the line of the ball and whack it over deep midwicket. It was the slower ball but he picked it and sent it cleanly over the boundary
short and wide, slapped away to deep backward point
short of a length ball, angling in on leg and nipping in, tucked to the leg side. No run there
flicks this length ball to the leg side and midwicket makes a sharp, diving save
fuller outside off, drills it back past the bowler and the ball is fielded at mid-off
tossed up outside off, Latham backs away slightly to give himself room before driving it wide of mid-off
turned away to midwicket, can't get past the fielder there
gets it well over mid-off and the ball bounces a couple of times before going past the boundary. It was flighted and Munro made room for himself before launching it
stays in the crease and tucks this length ball to midwicket
this one's even better. Comes down a couple of steps and tries to meet the pitch of the ball. Maybe did not get as close to it as he would have liked but still manages to loft it over long-on
worked down to long-on
shuffles across in his crease and bunts this length ball to the right of the bowler
short and wide, cut powerfully square of the wicket, deep backward point runs to his left and cuts it off

century comes with a clean hit over deep midwicket. It was short and Latham was waiting for it. Picks the length early, gets into a nice position and pulls it clean over deep midwicket. Second ODI century for Latham. Proud moment for dad Rod Latham, who is present at the venue. Soaks in a warm ovation from his hometown crowd
short ball outside off, cut past backward point
short ball, controls the pull shot to deep backward square leg
fuller ball, pushes it past the outstretched hands of the bowler as the ball goes over Taskin after bouncing
short ball, cut through point
swept behind square
driven to long-on
gets down to sweep and gets a top edge that lobs over past the wicketkeeper. Seems like it went off the toe end. Lucky to get away
fuller ball, eased down to long-on
back of a length ball, turned away off the pads past midwicket
fuller ball, eased down to long-on
short ball, pulled along the ground past deep midwicket. There is a fielder in the deep but it beats him to the ropes comfortably
short of a length, banged in from around the stumps, tries to tuck it away but gets it off the pads behind square
stays leg side of this fuller ball and drills it hard to extra cover
swipes hard and swipws well. Fifty for Munro comes with a clean hit over cow corner. It was on a length and sufficient room on offer for Munro to free his arms
yorker, squeezes it out past the bowler who can't stop it despite the dive. Long-on fires a throw but the batsman has made it
short of good length ball, drops it wide of point for a quick single
comes forward to this length ball and pushes it into the covers region
short ball, it is angled in to the left-hander, but there is still enough room for Munro who had backed away quite some distance. Nails the pull past deep midwicket
short of a length ball, had made room again and ends up reaching out for it in the end. Slapped away to sweeper cover

dropped. Mushfiqur Rahim puts down a tough chance behind the stumps. It was a short ball and Latham was trying to pull it away. Not enough room and he edges it to the right of the keeper. Seems like he skewed it off the glove. Rahim dives full length to the right but the ball is also dipping as it gets to him and he can't hold on to it
good length ball, plays across the line and ends up skewing it to long-on
full and wide, Munro was staying leg side of the ball and was in position early. Lofts it well over the in-field on the off side and the ball goes away to the sweeper cover boundary
this one's even better. On a length and on middle stump channel. Munro swipes hard and gets it clean over deep midwicket. Good pace - 142kph - on the delivery also helped
low full toss outside off, driven to sweeper cover
tries a yorker and ends up bowling another low full toss that is worked away wide of long-on for a single
slower full ball, angling in, worked away behind square on the leg side
yorker on middle and leg, jams his bat down and gets it through the vacant mid-on region. Lack of pace meant that the ball went slowly towards long-on and it gives them enough time to run two
fuller ball, driven to long-off
slower length ball outside off, seemed line the off-cutter, played with an open bat face to backward point

good length outside off, Munro swipes across the line and he does not time it well. The bat turns in his hands but that is struck incredibly hard. Long-on, who is slightly wide, runs across but has no chance of getting anywhere close to the ball
slower, short of a length ball, tucked to midwicket and good running as they come back for the second

flays one across the line and gets it all the way for a six and the 300 for New Zealand. It was a good length ball that was angled across and Latham hits it across the line, gets it over deep midwicket
fuller length ball, swept across the line behind square
wide yorker from Mashrafe and Latham squeezes it out as he jams his bat down in time. The ball bounces on the turf and over the fielder at backward point who dives with his right hand outstretched
short of a length, that is a long way outside off and Munro does not get anywhere near it so he misses. The ball hits the knee of Mushfiqur and gets away from him
fuller ball, angling, flicked away off the toes through deep backward square leg
fuller ball outside off, driven square of the wicket and sweeper cover runs across and cuts it off in the deep point region

dropped at deep midwicket. Munro comes down the track and makes room for himself before lofting it. The fielder there makes a meal of it though he got around the ball with enough time. Shakib not amused
goes for the reverse sweep, misses it altogether and gets rapped on the pads. Appeal turned down. That was missing leg

comes down the track and makes room before trying to clear the in-field on the off-side. But Shakib did well to take the ball away from the left-hander. It was the slider arm ball and Munro was beaten by pace as well. Skews it to point who runs back and snaffles it
stays in the crease and waits for this flat ball before knocking it to sweeper cover
flat and short of good length, worked to deep midwicket
pushes it square of the wicket on the off side and sweeper cover has to make some ground running to his right. They have enough time to grab two
fuller ball, clipped uppishly through square leg and they dart back for the second
full on leg stump, pushed to mid-on

chases a wide, fuller ball and edges it to the wicketkeeper. Had to reach out for it and it is a simple catch for Mushfiqur. Walks out to a rich applause from the crowd. Proud moment for the hometown boy
tucks it off the pads through square leg to get off the mark with a brace
back of a length outside off, tails back in just a tad late and Santner just presents a straight bat and drops it into the off side, leaving Mustafizur to collect it on the follow-through
back of a length, pulled straight to short fine leg. Santner calls for a quick single
short of a length ball, Ronchi tries to pull and bottom-edges it to the pads
you miss, I hit. Fuller ball on off and middle. Ronchi swipes as he looks to heave it through the leg side. Can't put bat to ball which crashes into the stumps. Missed a straight ball
very full ball outside off, jams his bat down and squeezes it out to square third man
picks this length ball off the pads and turns it away to deep backward square leg
short ball, angled across. Gets up too much for Santner to make connection with the attempted upper cut. Had made some room as well, so it's harder to reach
steep bounce again. Santner makes a half attempt at a hook and the ball comfortably sails over the bat
short of good length, on leg stump, Southee moved his front leg outside leg, so he wears it on the pad and the ball goes to fine leg
very full ball that is angled in, pushed just wide of long-on. They take on the fielder and sprint back for the second and Mashrafe isn't too pleased with the effort
very full on the fifth-stump channel, drilled away to long-off
there's Southee's big-hitting ability. Thumps this fuller ball through long-off. It's a half-volley and some room is all Southee needs
drags his length back but the ball does not bounce enough to unsettle Southee. He pulls but does not get hold of it completely and the ball goes on the bounce to deep midwicket
short ball, misses the pull as the ball sneaks from beneath the bottom edge. They run the bye and Mushfiqur cannot hit the stumps with his throw

inn2.comm: starts off with a delivery down the leg side that brushes the pad of Tamim as it goes to the wicketkeeper
good length ball on the stumps, holding its line, defended back to the bowler
fuller ball, gets it to shape away outside off, Tamim is content to let it go
good length ball outside off, Tamim blocks it to point
short ball from Boult. Tamim manages to hook it fine but wasn't really in control of it. That came at reasonable height and Tamim was cramped for room as well
lovely ball to end the over. Short of a length, aimed at the stumps but leaves the left-hander as it swings away sharply. Tamim keeps his bat inside the line and offers no stroke
fuller ball, pushed to mid-off on the up

was that a chance! Yes, it was. Dropped. Southee did almost everything right there and failed to hold on to the catch. Hurries the batsman with a short ball. Kayes responds with a pull shot that he ends up skewing back towards Southee. He dives forward on the follow-through and misses it by inches. Definitely carried to him. Tough chance, though
sprays it full and wide, it's way outside off and called a wide
short ball again and Kayes hooks the ball. Does not seem to be in control of that, seems like he got it off the top edge but the ball carries all the way over the deep backward square leg boundary
he's in more control of this one but it bounces before the boundary. Similar short ball but it does not bounce as much as the previous one and this time Kayes controls the pull behind square
short of a length, tries to flick and gets hit high on the pad
short of a length, angling in, tries to tuck it away and gets it off the pad to square leg
fullish length, attacking the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
good length ball, moves away sharply after landing and beats the outside edge of Kayes who sticks his bat out in the channel outside off
turns this length ball away to deep midwicket
fuller ball on the stumps, shuffles across to protect his off-stump and blocks
good length ball, stays in the crease and defends and the ball goes off the inside part to the leg side
full and wide ball, opens his arms up and cracks it through the off side but can't pierce the field
good length on the stumps, protects his stump and blocks
fuller outside off, checks his forward push towards mid-off and takes a quick single
good length ball, left alone in the channel outside off
chases a full and wide ball and there is a noise as the ball is caught by the wicketkeeper. Southee goes up in appeal but nothing from Ronchi. That was the bat hitting the ground
stays in the crease to this length ball and defends off the inside part of the bat back to the bowler
short and wide, slapped off the backfoot through extra cover. Mid-off gives it a chase but the outfield is very quick
fuller and on the fifth-stump channel, driven to covers
tries to cut this back of a length ball but it does not bounce as much as he expects it to and he ends up bottom-edging it behind the stumps
short ball, too high and called a wide
tucked off the pads through square leg. Deep backward square leg runs across and cuts it off
short of a length, drops it into the off side off the backfoot
good length ball, defended from outside off straight down the pitch
length ball on the stumps, defended
short of a length ball, angling in from outside off, blocked off the backfoot
short ball, tries to hook but the bounce is too steep and he cannot make contact
another bouncer to end the over. It's well-directed. Kayes tries to arch back and awkwardly ramp it but makes no contact as he cannot deal with the bounce
comes down the track and cracks it through the off side after making room. But he can't beat the field
good length ball, defended into the off side
short ball, Tamim is able to ride the bounce as he swivels around and pulls to deep square leg
back of a length, turned away to square leg
short ball, gets on top of the bounce and pulls straight to midwicket
good length on the stumps, defends into the off side off the front foot. The bowler cuts across in the follow-through to cut it off
fuller ball outside off, squeezes it out towards point and checks the bottom part of his bat after completing the stroke

what an effort from Santner! Could have pulled off a stunner. It was a short ball and Kayes pulled it with all might. Santner has to run across from deep backward square leg all the way to the deep midwicket region. The ball is travelling at some speed too as it was fiercely struck. Santner puts in the dive but the ball just about escapes his palms

and HotSpot confirms that it was an edge. Short ball. Kayes swivels around and pulls but skews it off the edge to the wicketkeeper who dives to his right and takes the catch. Kayes reviews it but it anyway seemed like it had gone off the glove. Replays then show that it has taken a healthy edge and the on-field decision stays
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot into the off side
short of a length ball. Tries to cut but it was angling in and he gets cramped for room. Ends up chopping it
fuller ball, bends forward and pushes it along the ground towards mid-off
full and wide, gets a neat stride across and drives straight to extra cover
pacy delivery, 147kph, sprays it down the leg side, though, and it is called a wide
good pace, 146.8 kph, but wrong line again as he fires it down leg
good length ball, pitches on middle and angles across, defended
length ball on the leg stump channel, tucked off the pads to deep fine leg
back of a length ball, shuffles across and defends from the crease
stays in the crease and blocks this short of a length ball without feet. Good pace again - 149kph
fuller ball, Tamim gets forward and crisply drives between cover and extra cover. Outfield is lightning quick si it easily beats the fielders and races away to the boundary
back of a length, punched off the backfoot to mid-off
short ball, rolls his wrists over the pull shot and the ball is pulled back before the deep midwicket boundary
short of a length, strides across and defends to point
short ball, tries to pull, makes no connection, whistles past his left ear
moved around the wicket to a back of a length ball outside off. Tamim thought there was more room than what was on offer and tried to cut, beaten by extra bounce
short of good length on off, defended to the off side

ooh, lucky boundary. That was a superb short ball, had Tamim scampering for cover. Tamim was trying to get out of the way but perhaps did not drop his wrists low enough. Might have been undone by the pace as well as the ball goes off the glove and a part of the helmet as well over the keeper and the cordon
fuller on off and middle, defended back towards the bowler
bouncer on the stumps, Tamim arches back and lets it go
tries to pull this back of a length ball and does not find the middle of the bat
short of good length, pokes at it without feet and defends to cover-point

held by Williamson moving to his right. It was fuller outside off and Sarkar was looking to heave it over the extra cover region. Opens the face of his bat and does not time it properly. Ends up chipping it in the air and Williamson who is at mid-off takes it
good length ball on off, Mahmudullah waits in the crease and defends with an open bat face into the off side
fuller and on the stumps, Mahmudullah defends back to the bowler
chases a wide one and gets a healthy edge to the keeper. Floats a tempter a set of stumps outside off and Mahmudullah falls for the bait. Double strike for Neesham. Bangladesh need to be careful now
fuller on leg and middle, pushed gently back to the bowler. Double-wicket maiden from Neesham
fuller ball, angled across, gets a good stride across and drives elegantly just wide of extra cover
fuller ball, clipped off the pads to midwicket
back of a length ball, gets the front leg out of the way and pulls to backward square leg
short ball, down the leg side, Shakib barely has to duck
tucked just wide of the short fine leg fielder
fuller ball on the pads, gets it off the inside part of the bat to mid-on
short ball, not in control of the pull shot and top-edges it. Falls in no man's land around the square leg region
nudged to midwicket for a single
gives the early charge and Neesham fires it wide. It's short of good length and goes away from Tamim who can't get anywhere near it
shortish on middle, fends it away behind square leg
tries to cut but it's not short enough for that shot and he gets beaten
short ball, gets a top-edge on the pull and gets it away to deep midwicket
muted appeal for lbw as Ferguson sends down a a 140-plus thunder bold, full and straight. The umpire reckons there is an inside edge though
thick edge, flies past the lone slip. At 147 kph, they tend to. Good length ball from Ferguson, drawing the drive on the up. He's in the middle of a good spell
keeps it right up there on middle and leg, Tamim clips the 147 kph delivery through mdiwicket
back of a length at 148 kph, tapped into the covers
fuller delivery on off stump, pushes to mid-off
shortish on leg stump, at 142 kph, Shakib swivels on his back foot and pulls to long leg. That'll be drinks

misfield at deep cover by Santner, but it doesn't necessarily amount to any runs considering Tamim and Shakib were content with the couple it was always going to be. Top shot though to get it that far, taking a good length ball outside off and driving on the up off the front foot
slid into the pads and Tamim's tends to be comfortable flicking those away like he would an annoying little fly on his nose
good length ball on fourth stump, Shakib was trying to tap and run to mid-on, but Neesham moves to his left in time to foil the nefarious plan
invites the drive again, with a fuller length and wider line, Shakib is unable to beat mid-off
rolls on his back foot to pull a shortish delivery - at stomach height - to midwicket

moves around the wicket, and Tamim exploits the angle immediately, wandering across onto off stump, waiting for the back of a length delivery to arrive and nudging it behind square leg. Lovely batting. All he had to do was place it, and to do that he had to delay the roll of the wrist
back of a length, on leg stump, clips to deep square leg
hooks, on instinct, as a bouncer comes for his nose. Top edge falls safely beyond the reach of midwicket, and well short of the man running in from the deep
lays into a drive but the good length ball outside off finds mid-off. Bangladesh playing pin ball
seems to have come in just a tad, which is useful considering the batsman was moving across onto off stump. Tamim is cramped up as he drives to mid-on
digs in a bouncer on middle and leg, the batsman avoids it. Too high to control it at any rate
waits on a shortish delivery just outside off, but finds point with his glide.
not enough width, though the length was there to cut, Shakib minds his wickets with a straight bat
lashed past point. Diving effort from Broom, sticking his left hand out, horizontal with the ground when the ball deflected off his fingers
full on middle and leg, bunted by his feet. And he will get ready for a free hit with Neesham having overstepped
swing and a miss. Well, that was a waste. Neesham moves over the wicket, for the angle across the left-hander - offers a length ball, Shakib swings across the line and comes up with so much nothing
around the wicket again for a good length ball on off stump, keeps it out

beautiful pull shot. There is no power in this, only timing, because Shakib picks the length early, swivels on his back foot, and has no flourish of the bat. Simply directed it to the backward square leg boundary like he is a traffic policeman
full and down leg, from around the stumps, umpire calls wide
fuller ball on leg and middle, now over the wicket, driven to mid-on

he's upper cut the ball to deep point. Good grief. Stands forlorn as he watches Santner running in from the boundary and sealing the catch with some style. It is short. It is asking to be hit. It becomes a wicket. There's something very scoreboard pressure about this wicket. That, or I'm being kind to a terrible shot
full, attacking the stumps, Shakib protects it with a fine piece of willow
seems like a slower ball on off stump, Shakib picks it, taps it to cover and sneaks a quick single
gets on top of this short ball on off stump and runs it to point
wafts at a sweet-as-honey length ball wafting across him. This is very similar to the ball that got Mahmudullah. Going for the on-the-up drive, lucky not to nick off
keeps to his crease and carves a short delivery behind point. Has far more control that he is letting the ball come to him rather than going out looking for it
full on off stump, pushed to mid-on
back of a length, rising towards his chest, Mushfiqur drops it behind square leg for a single
advances on the bowler, who in turn slings it well wide of his reach. Shakib leaves it
late cuts a shortish delivery on middle stump to deep third man. Good control.
back of a length and outside off, steers to point
good line. It's around fifth stump - and on this true pitch - Neesham is getting the ball to carry through nicely. Mushfiqur avoids it
short and wide, Mushfiqur would be disappointed he got it off the bottom of the bat , for one, and then he finds point too
fuller ball on off stump, defends into the off side
fuller ball on off stump, defends
shortish and outside off, cut behind point
leans into a drive and the good length ball outside off is fielded well at cover
goes for a pull, but is rather slow on it. Gets an under edge as the ball coming up at his right ear, bounces along to the wicketkeeper
moves around the wicket and makes a back of a length delivery kick up on Mushfiqur, who fends it away with soft hands towards point. Not in control, but he'll take not losing his wicket to this brute
covers the line of a short delivery on middle
shortish and outside off, slices behind point
races down the track, making room for himself, Southee is wise to the naughty tactic and follows the right-hander. Mistimes the pull over square leg
yanks a short ball from outside off and tennis fore-hands it to midwicket. Think he makes contact with both feet off the ground.
shortish and outside off, cut to point
hammered over midwicket. Again his feet are in the air so that he can gain the height to tonk the short delivery outside off. Massive power in those wrists
continues taking on the short ball, althougth this one climbs higher, around his chest, and is cramping him up as well. Top-edge to deep square leg
flighted outside off, drives through the covers. Most of the men are on the leg side, protecting hits with the spin
lashed over extra cover. It is tossed up - on a half-volley - and Shakib knows there aren't very many boundary riders on the off side. Get it over the infield and profit
good length ball, still bowling slow through the air, defends to point
sliding down leg, Mushfiqur glances it fine and is sharp enough to spot and convert a two
flatter and quicker on middle, Mushfiqur clips it through midwicket
short and wide, cuts past point's right
width outside off, but when Shakib cuts, he does so under the ball and misses it
and he pulls over the region made vacant. One of the easier pulls in this innings, oconsidering the short ball doesn't rise up, and is offering room as well. Plus no fielders inside the circle
back of a length, but not far enough outside off for the cut. Shakib attempts to glide it to third man, but the pace and bounce, this time, is too much for him
moves across to the shortish delivery and taps it through the gap at point - and it's also placed between the third man and the sweeper on the boundary. Beautiful cricket
full and outside off, drives to mid-off
moves around the wicket for a short ball angled into off stump, pulls to long leg
tossed up on middle, Shakib bunts it into the leg side
directs a length ball into the vacant spaces at square leg
turns the bat into a ramp as he takes a length ball and shovels it over his left shoulder
backs away as he cuts a shortish delivery to point
goes for a sweep, but Santner held this delivery back just enough to get a top edge, onto the back of his helmet
moves back and blocks the length ball on leg stump
141 kph, good length ball outside off, eased to point
opens the face and glides a 140 kph delivery behind point
attempts to use the place - there's plenty of it at 144 kph - but his tap to third man doesn't come off as the ball skips away to the wicketkeeper

helped over the fine leg boundary as Shakib pulls from down to up. Brilliant little innings so far. In that he has picked the short ball early and often made the most of it, like this time. Vehemently disagreeing with all those people who talk about subcontinent batsmen not playing well abroad when the ball kicks off the pitch
fuller ball on leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
nudged off his pads to long leg. Balls at 145 kph aren't very useful when they are off target
tossed up on leg stump, drills it to long-on
nicely tossed up on off stump, Mushfiqur can only defend because he has no pace, width or length to work with
resorts to the sweep, and takes a ball on middle stump sending it to deep square leg. Risky shot, but he clears his front leg to make it happen
slips down leg, as Santner seems wary of Shakib coming down at him. Flung it fast and down leg
shortish and outside off, Shakib pats it past point and brings up his fifty at a-run-a-ball. Warm applause from the Boxing Day crowd. He's looking good to take this deep
pulls out the scoop again, and it works out rather well, with Santner panicking and bowling still flatter. All that does is help the batsman get under the ball and help it over the wicketkeeper
no risk with that sweep considering Shakib planted his front leg outside off and the ball was sliding down leg
top-edges a pull, but Southee moving to his left at mid-on, cant get under it. Seems to have moved rather slow there
flat-batted over long-on. Don't you bowl that at me, he says, taking a short and wide delivery and swinging for the fences

one shot too many. Ferguson continues with the short ball - this time he gets one to rise up to the chest, the line is on off stump as well. That means the pull is a dangerous shot, the batsman can't get any leverage. The top edge seems academic and Southee completes a simple catch moving to his left at midwicket
full on middle and leg, whips through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, steers it to third man
slants a back of a length ball at 144 kph down the leg side, Mushfiqur's leg glance doesn't make contact
sweet square drive, but he finds point. Mushfiqur is 13 off 21 balls in a run-chase of 342
fuller ball on off stump, defends into the covers
short and wide, he cuts to the man in the deep. It's the legcutter

smacks a short ball past point. Superb cut shot, didn't really have room, but the timing is remarkable. Needed a superb save from Boult on the boundary, running a great distance to his left and throwing himself at the ball. Pulls it back inches from the boundary
half an appeal from New Zealand as a short ball goes down leg. Mushfiqur went for a pull and misses
pulls a short ball from outside off to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, steers it to third man
full on off stump, Sabbir taps it to the right of mid-on and scampers across
flighted on off stump, dabs to backward point
blocks with the open face to point
drifts down leg, he nudges it to fine leg
flighted outside off, Mushfiqur drives to cover
an in-between length on off stump, not allowing Mushfiqur to come forward, or go back. In the end, he blocks to point
steps forward and defends on off stump. That's drinks
138kph, charges in for a shortish delivery on middle and leg, Sabbir deflects it off his hip to long leg
short and a shade outside off, Mushfiqur short-arm pulls it to deep midwicket
that's the slower ball, angled into leg stump, cramping Sabbir, as he plays a hook. Gets a top edge that soars over the short boundary at long leg

helps a short ball to third man. Course Boult has to help himself too, diving forward to take a good low catch. Made sure when he came in contact with the ground, it wasn't with the elbow, which tends to pop the ball out. Poor Sabbit. If he were playing bulls-eye with the fielder there, he would be walking away with a prize. Considering he isn't...
new batsman gets a short ball on middle and off to tackle. Avoids it
back of a length on off stump, defends
shortish and outside off, sliced to point
goes for the reverse sweep, and after considerable effort, a length ball on middle and off is lifted over backward point to the boundary
now the conventional sweep, taking a fuller ball on off stump and smashing it to deep square leg
long hop down leg, Mushfiqur pulls, but hits it to straight long leg. "Uuuurrrrrghhhh," cries the batsman in disgust
flighted onto off stump, blocks. "Hell of a ball there," says Ronchi from behind the stumps.
moves back to a flatter delivery on middle and leg and clips it behind square leg
140kph, good length ball wanders down the leg side, Mosaddek tries a flick and fails to make connection
opens the face as he meets a back of a length delivery. No run to point.
137kph, back of a length on off stump, taps to mid-on
gets a feather on this short ball, that takes it past the wicketkeeper's reach. Mosaddek pulls at a ball around hip height, but doesn't quite get it the way he would like. Would take the runs though
beaten for pace as a short and wide delivery goes begging
cramped up on leg stump, as he pulls to long leg. Hopping around is Mosaddek. He doesn't like Ferguson's pace, even if it has come down from his first spell
138 kph, dug in fairly short on middle and leg, Mushfiqur avoids it. Wanders off for byes as well
shimmies down at the left-arm spinner, who shortens his length in response. Mushfiqur cuts to deep point
goes back to a length ball on middle, defends
stands rooted in his crease as he blocks a length ball that turns away, first one that has
slower through the air, as he tosses it up and makes Mosaddek reach forward to block

"catch that," is the cry as Mosaddek runs down the pitch and lofts it, aiming to clear long-off. And he does so, barely. Southee is the man there, waiting, waiting, and waiting before leaping up as high as he can, sticking out his right hand. No luck
shortish and coming in with the arm towards off stump, cut to point
carves the short ball over the slips
mistimes a pull, going for it against a back of a length delivery that afforded him no room. Checks his shot
pulls to deep midwicket, dragging an attempted bouncer from outside off into the leg side
fuller delivery outside off, Mushfiqur leaves and collects the extra run
tries to glide a shortish delivery outside off past gully, but Guptill there makes sure it doesn't amount to anything
wanders outside off and scopps a length ball, a slower ball at 119 kph, over the wicketkeeper. Good shot. Excellently executed
pulls through straight midwicket to bring up the 200. Short and wide, allowing the batsman to get under the ball and power it away
flighted on middle and leg, blunts it
looks for a leg glance, moving across his stumps to a ball sliding down. Misses
good length ball - quicker - Mosaddek defends
tries to flick a slower, length delivery off his pads, but with no pace to work with, he can't succeed
that's lovely. Backs away against the shortish delivery outside off and late cuts it to deep point
flicks a length ball on middle into vacant midwicket, so Santner has to race across to it himself
tosses it up outside off, he drives to long-off
back of a length and outside off, eased to deep third man
full and outside off, aims for a front-foot lash through extra cover and doesn't connect
goes short, and Mushfiqur pulls to deep midwicket, rolling his wrists on the ball
that's smart work. Sees width, realises if he places it to the left of point and the right of third man there is a boundary. Does so by simply opening the face
moves around the wicket for a full ball on off stump, digs it out
good length ball on off stump, defends
pulls out a reverse sweep, but having to take the ball from leg stump, he finds point

gets down the track and hammers the ball to mid-on. Mushfiqur goes for a risky single, has to put in the drive, and it seems he may have injured his left shoulder? Oh wait, the physio is testing his left hamstring. Is it just cramp? Can it be cramp, with the weather so pleasant? Either way, it doesn't look good. Mushfiqur is still flat on his back, receiving medical attention
flighted delivery, attacking the stumps, driven to covers
sprayed down the leg side
tries to tuck to the leg side and take off for a run but is sent back
gets his front leg out of the way and slogs this length ball to deep midwicket. Mushfiqur can barely limp across for the single
slower short of a length ball, picks the drop in pace and waits for it before laying into a pull shot. Picks the gap in the deep midwicket region
fuller ball, driven to long-off
drifting in with the arm and strikes the front pad but was heading down leg
fuller ball, defended back to the bowler with bat close to pad
comes down the track to meet the pitch of the ball and lofts it over the leg side, the ball goes on the bounce over the deep midwicket boundary
tucked behind square
good length ball, Mortaza flat-bats it over mid-on, comfortably beats the fielder there and the ball goes a couple of bounces over the boundary
short ball, Mortaza backs away and ducks under
fuller ball, driven on the up past the diving short extra cover fielder before the ball is cut off in the deep
pokes at it without feet and gets an outside edge that runs away towards third man
arches back and this time deliberately runs it down to third man, does so uppishly as he opens the bat face really late

makes room for himself but Santner follows him and Mortaza is cramped for room. He is not able to free his arms as well as he would have liked and his wild slog only carries till the fielder at deep midwicket. And Mortaza's burst meets a swift end
fuller ball, eased down to long-off
flighted on middle stump, gets forward and blocks back to the bowler
oh, that's a clean hit. No power, just timing and placement on that one. It was a loopy flighted ball that was sliding in with the arm, and Mosaddek backs away before lofting it over long-off
short and wide outside off, slapped away
tucked to deep midwicket
fires a good length ball in the corridor and draws the batsman forward, Taskin sticks his bat out and gets beaten
tries to force this short of a length ball through the off side but gets undone by the extra bounce
fuller ball, turned away to midwicket
short ball, tries to pull but the ball bounces steeply and he gets pinged on the helmet, near the ear
short ball outside off, tries to ramp it but can't deal with the bounce and misses
gets across to cover his off-stump and pushes this length ball towards mid-on
stays a long way away from the ball and whacks it with a half flat bat towards mid-on. No run there
backs away and tries to flat-bat this short of a length ball over the off-side field but misses as the ball follows him and cramps him for room
sees some width on offer and opens the face of his bat to uppishly guide this length ball to third man
good length on the fifth-stump channel, Taskin shuffles across and blocks into the off side
big top edge on the pull, snaffled by Ronchi behind the stumps. It was a short ball and he was in no position to play it. Not enough room and finds it hard to deal with the bounce as well
short of a length, angling in, swats it it over mid-on with a flat bat
slower wide ball, cut square of the wicket and that brings up the fifty for Mosaddek

yorker on off-stump. Mustafizur backed away and tried to play a cover drive away from the body. Does not put bat to ball and the ball crashes into the stumps. And that will be the end of the match as Rahim is not coming out to bat
